posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
Hi, I’m use Studica VMX controller with Raspberry PI 4 inside.

Using this URL

RoboRIO installation: If you have robotpy-installer on your computer, then installing robotpy-cscore is very simple: Windows Linux/macOS For additional details about running robotpy-installer on yo...

trying install cscore using command pip3 install -U robotpy[cscore] --find-links= Index of /~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/

get error messages

In file included from build/temp.linux-armv7l-cpython-37/gensrc/wpiutil/DataLog.cpp:5: /tmp/pip-install-ec5bem0_/robotpy-wpiutil_c90a9725405949998d26494bb4b109c6/wpiutil/include/wpi/DataLog.h:12:10: fatal error: span: No such file or directory #include ^~~~~~ compilation terminated. /tmp/pip-build-env-ptyyddlw/overlay/lib/python3.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/build_py.py:153: SetuptoolsDeprecationWarning:     Installing ‘wpiutil.src’ as data is deprecated, please list it in packages .

How can I fix this problem and install robotpy?

Best Regards, Alex

posts.name: Davo
posts.cooked:
What distro are you using?

WPILib dropped support for distros older than Debian 11 Bullseye this year.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
Thank you a lot!. I’m upgrading now to Debian 11 Bullseye and will check.

Anybody has experience with RobotPy and Studica VMX + Titan controllers? Is it possible use it with RobotPy?

Best Regards, Alex

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: I don’t think it will work. VMX-PI uses a heavily customized version of WPILIb 2020. Someone would need to create a custom version of robotpy that wrapped that version to be able to talk to any hardware.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
fedalal:

trying install cscore using command pip3 install -U robotpy[cscore] --find-links= Index of /~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/

If you’re just trying to install/use robotpy-cscore, as long as you’re on a supported distro it should work fine. You can just run:

fedalal:

Anybody has experience with RobotPy and Studica VMX + Titan controllers? Is it possible use it with RobotPy?

As far as I know you would not be able to use RobotPy to control their controllers.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
Hi, Thank you for your answers. I’m install latest version of Raspberry Debian image, but still get error when trying install robotpy modules.

Maybe there is a way to install only cscore python library. I need start CameraServer only from my python program

Best Regards, Alex

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: What is the error? And what does cat /etc/os-release provide?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
cat /etc/os-release

PRETTY_NAME=“Raspbian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)” NAME=“Raspbian GNU/Linux” VERSION_ID=“11” VERSION=“11 (bullseye)” VERSION_CODENAME=bullseye ID=raspbian ID_LIKE=debian

---------------------- ERROR----------------------

ERROR: Failed building wheel for robotpy-halsim-gui Failed to build robotpy-halsim-gui ERROR: Could not build wheels for robotpy-halsim-gui which use PEP 517 and cannot be installed directly

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: Only install robotpy-cscore , not robotpy[cscore] . Does that work?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
No, I have limit 2 links, so paste error test as image

image 1875×3068 381 KB

image 1875×3068 381 KB

image 1875×3068 381 KB

You have to use the command provided above: pip3 install robotpy-cscore --find-links=https://tortall.net/~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/

Just pip3 install robotpy-cscore will not work.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
Hi, Thank you a lot! Its working now and I can use CameraServer from python.

Best Regards, Alex

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
Thank you all for help. Now I have only 1 problem with VMX controller and Python.

How to use Studica Titan controller?

In Java program I can use this imports

import com.studica.frc.TitanQuad; import com.studica.frc.TitanQuadEncoder;

Is this any case get source of this libs and convert it to Python ?

Best Regards, Alex

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: You would need to contact the vendor and see if they support that. I’m guessing that they don’t.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
